title: Mind-Body Therapies
description: Mind-body therapies focus on the connection between your body, your mental health and emotional well-being, and the social, spiritual, and behavioral factors that influence your health.
cleaned_text: the connection between your body, your [mental health](https://www.crohnscolitisfoundation.org/mental-health) and emotional well-being, and the social, spiritual, and behavioral factors that influence your health. These connections are so important that some treatments that were once considered [complementary medicine](https://nccih.nih.gov/sites/nccam.nih.gov/files/Whats_In_A_Name_06-16-2016.pdf) including [cognitive behavioral therapy ](https://www.crohnscolitisfoundation.org/mental-health/coping-strategies-for-better-mental-health)and [patient support groups ](/find-a-support-group) are now offered as conventional therapy. Common mind-body therapies - Relaxation and mindfulness - Hypnosis (trance state characterized by extreme suggestibility, relaxation and heightened imagination) - Acupuncture (the practice of inserting small needles into specific points along the skin) - Yoga - Exercise Talk to your doctor about incorporating mind-body therapies to help reduce stress
